videos.title: Forbidden Gravel Experience: Gravel Bike Race in Cumberland, BC. Vancouver Island. 🇨🇦
videos.description:
Come and ride along with us on the 40 km Piccolo course and meet some awesome people in the Forbidden Gravel Experience Gravel race in Cumberland, BC on Vancouver Island. It was a well organized event with lots of fun people, draw prizes/swag and great snacks! Cumberland has an awesome mountain bike trail system in a beautiful forest, along with fabulous gravel routes. Many thanks to all the volunteers for your time and effort in hosting this fabulous event. 
#vancouverisland #gravelracing #specializedwomen #fge2022 #cumberland #specialized 
 #arrowsmithbikes #tastegrynd #pertheswarrior #girlsgonegroad
#biggribbikes #coalcitycycles

videos.title: The Forbidden Gravel Experience
videos.description:
Mark your calendars:  September 11th, 2021

The Strathcona Cycling Society presents the inaugural Forbidden Gravel Experience!  It features the renowned community of Cumberland & the stunning scenery of Comox Lake

Sign up today:

forbiddengravelexperience.com

videos.title: 2025 Forbidden Gravel - Trek BC Gravel Series
videos.description: Highlight Reel from the 2025 Forbidden Gravel Event taking place in the Village of Cumberland - The 4th and Final stop of the Trek BC Gravel Series p/b Bluebird Self Storage

videos.title: Repurposed // Gravel Riding in British Columbia
videos.description:
'Repurposed' From perfect gravel roads to gravel hotels, bike festivals, stacked local groups rides and everything in between, from Chris Hatton's perspective, British Columbia is a mecca for gravel, and it deserves some level of recognition for the amazing things happening here. 

For gravel riders, we’re able to use these roads for adventure and exploration, linking together single-day routes and bikepacking trips alike, leading to some pretty epic days out. 

With gravel being just one of the ways that this infrastructure is being used for something other than forestry, this seems to be creating another layer of value for this network that wasn’t there before, and there seems to be something profound about that. We’re able to access these wild places on bikes because of this extensive forest road network, and that’s partially why BC is such a unique place for this kind of riding. 

//
Storyteller
Chris Hatton www.instagram.com/chrisrjhatton

//
Project Partners
Teravail https://teravail.com
We Are One Composites www.weareonecomposites.com
7Mesh https://7mesh.com/

//
Film & Production
Pierre-Luc Arseneau www.instagram.com/plarseneau

i feel like this is an a meeting man

so

videos.title: Gravel Biking Trip to Cumberland, BC! | Gravel Biking Vancouver Island
videos.description:
In this video, I take a 5 hour gravel journey up to Cumberland, British Columbia on Vancouver Island.

Thanks for watching!

#gravelbiking
#mountainbiking
